FeedItems.Title: Getting Started With NuGet 5.8
FeedItems.Summary:
Getting started with NuGet 5.8
NuGet 5.8 is included in Visual Studio 16.8 and .NET 5.0 out of the box. You can also download NuGet 5.8 for Windows, macOS, and Linux as a standalone executable.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[A11y]Enable horizontal scrollbar on cert table" (#8340) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This PR enables a scroll bar on the Certificates table.
According to Accessibility team, it is ok to have the scrollbar on the table itself, but not on the page.

Preview:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11051729/100818448-03e5c900-33ff-11eb-85fe-ad1b07f72975.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "MAS 2.5.3 - Label in Name" (#7532) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
UI components with labels that include text or images of text should have names that contain the text that is presented visually. E.g. a button with the visible text "submit" must have an `aria-label` that contains "submit" such as "submit the form".

I believe we are already compliant with this, but there may be some controls on the site that we need to fix.

Terminology:
- labels are the visible text used to identify control to all users
- names are the programmatic or accessible name of a control for screen readers/assistive technology

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "MAS 1.4.10 - Reflow" (#7525) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Our site should look good at 320 px by 256 px and users must not have to scroll horizontally to see any content.

I believe, in general, we are compliant with this, thanks to Bootstrap, but there may be some things we need to fix.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "MAS 1.3.5 - Identify Input Purpose" (#7524) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
We should verify our site uses the autocomplete attribute wherever it makes sense.

List of possible autocomplete attribute values: https://www.w3.org/TR/html52/sec-forms.html#autofill

For example, forms that accept email addresses should be configured to automatically fill in the user's email address.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "MAS 1.4.12 - Text spacing" (#7529) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
No loss of content or functionality should occur if
- line height is set to 1.5em
- spacing is set to 2 em
- letter space is set to .12em
- word spacing is set to .16em

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "MAS 1.4.11 - Non-text contrast" (#7528) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
UI components (anything that conveys information) needs to have color contrast of at least 3:1.

For context, previously only text needed to have proper contrast. We are now required to make sure graphs and other UI elements have proper contrast as well.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Latest release version of NuGet.*" (#8335) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Progress on https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8230

To enable Gallery to accept new OSI and FSF approved licenses need to bump NuGet.Packaging version.
The rest of NuGet.* packages were updated to align with NuGet.Packaging and get off preview version.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "nuget.exe 'list' command doesn't work for authorized feeds(?)" (#10340) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet.exe

5.8.0.6930

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

Right now I can successfully do 'nuget.exe search FOO' against authenticated feeds (GitHub Packages and Azure Artifacts), but trying the same thing using 'nuget.exe list' throws a warning and doesn't return results.

If I was able to have the same control of the search query in 'nuget search' that I can with 'nuget list' (see [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/consume-packages/finding-and-choosing-packages#search-syntax) ) then I would be OK, but I don't AFAICT.

Thanks!

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet CLI Bulk Unlister Tool" (#9897) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## **Problem Background**

Within the NuGet CLI, authors can choose either to [unlist](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/nuget-org/policies/deleting-packages#unlisting-a-package) or [deprecate](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/nuget-org/deprecate-packages) particular versions of their published packages to limit public access. There does not currently exist an efficient way to deprecate or unlist multiple or all versions of a package. This presents a process inefficiency that can be potentially significant for customers who must often unlist versions of their package due to security or dependency concerns.  In addition, having to manually unlist package versions can result in human error and lack of thoroughness.

## **Who are the customers**

Specific use cases are:

1. Customers who want to unlist all versions of their published package efficiently.
2. Customers who want to unlist most of the versions, with individual exceptions.
3. Customers who want to unlist a certain range of versions (i.e. 3.x and lower)
4. Customers who want to unlist versions with names that include a particular regular expression pattern. 

## Goals and Success Metrics

**Process Efficiency**

- Provide customers a faster and easier process for unlisting multiple or all versions of a package

**Control**

- Offer customers more control over the unlisting of their package versions.

**Security**

- Drive broader usage of the unlisting functionality to eliminate package vulnerabilities, bugs, and dependency errors across versions

## **Non-Goals**

**[NuGet.org](http://nuget.org) and Visual Studio**

This solution is for the NuGet CLI only. There will be no discussion surrounding UI on [NuGet.org](http://nuget.org) and the Visual Studio version of NuGet

**Deprecation**

This solution is for the unlisting functionality only. There will be no work done on bulk-deprecation.

## **Solution**

The solution will come in a form on a downloadable CLI tool. The first version of this tool will be straightforward and follows the following steps:

1. User invokes "unlist" command 
2. Existing versions are checked against the criteria for unlisting provided by the user
3. List of versions to be unlisted is printed to console. User is prompted to confirm.
    1. If user confirms, the tool proceeds to unlist all versions agreed upon
    2. If user does not confirm, the tool terminates and allows the user to revise their query
4. Once the process is complete, a list of the unlisted files will be printed to console

## **What:**

[Very simplified architecture](https://www.notion.so/Architecture-for-Bulk-Unlister-f7b062984b07440ebade5a0693d6549e) can be found here

[Specific CLI command examples to come]

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Dotnet pack command creates unwanted trash folders on Windows" (#10346) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
While investigating [issue#5127](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/5127),  I ran `dotnet pack --include-symbols --output '../Nugets'` on my Windows machine. 
Expected bevahior is :
1. `Nugets` folder on upper level 
2. Or simply fail due to bad formatted path.

Actual bevahior is: It did `Nugets` folder but also another broken folder for windows. It seems this command format is for MAC/Linux but nothing prevents it from running on Windows and create unwanted trash folder. Since name is not normal ASCII keys we can't easily delete it. I feel this one is polluting production or work environment, so we need to prevent it happening. It shouldn't  create this one or simply fail stating specified path is not valid.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8766776/100678480-1f2ed680-3322-11eb-9033-600a149503ea.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8766776/100678531-3e2d6880-3322-11eb-9045-a54887096e46.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Dotnet add package doesn't record custom source feed was used during restore" (#10345) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi.
While I was investigating [#5127](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/5127) I realized when user use custom source feed during `add package` then that information[ is not recorded into both asset and dpSpec files](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/5127#issuecomment-736676045). Maybe it could become source of confusion or security hole if we don't know where did this package came from during restore specially when use private feeds.

`>>dotnet add package Domain -s "..\Mypackages" --version 1.0.0`

![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5eb1d84a3cd56675c3efe510/bc8e25c1-ed8c-41e8-a90d-952865d895ea)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "FatalProtocolException in PackageSearchResource when deployed to Azure " (#10344) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello, I have the following problem :

NuGet product used NuGet.Protocol package version 5.8.0 :
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20421571/100789444-bf662780-3416-11eb-9709-260342e1b3f5.png)

I have create an Asp.Net core 5 website that list nuget package from my private nuget serveur. It works great when running on my computer but when deployed to Azure, I have the following error

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20421571/100789604-f9372e00-3416-11eb-8532-f8b39e0c6340.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20421571/100789222-731ae780-3416-11eb-97c5-212f71e97928.png)

Any tips for solving this issues ?

Thanks

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "SuppressDependenciesWhenPacking requires not working for net6.0-windows during the pack task" (#10343) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
SuppressDependenciesWhenPacking is not working when we set this property for tfm net6.0-windows. 
I did a little investigation and it seems like it works when we specify the this tfm as net6.0-windows7.0. 
i tested this by adding this to the project.
```
 <ItemGroup>
    <_FrameworksWithSuppressedDependencies Include="net6.0-windows7.0"/>
  </ItemGroup> 
```


cc @viktorHofer @ericst @safern

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "VersionRange cannot parse single-digit ranges" (#10342) at NuGet/Home
Reopened issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
¬†
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	¬∑ **Nov. 11, 2020** ‚Äì 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	¬∑ **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**¬† ‚Äì¬†48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
¬†
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	¬∑ UTC-9 to UTC-2 ‚Äì¬†[Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC-1 to UTC+6 ‚Äì¬†[Yellow test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Yellow+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3915&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC+7 to UTC-10 ‚Äì¬†[Blue test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Blue+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3909&ah=4)
